N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1633.5 - Applications and grants

State Regulations
(a) To
apply for a grant under this Part, an authority shall submit an application to
the division at such time and in such manner as the division may reasonably
require in a notice of funding availability. Such application shall include all
information as may be required by the division as well as a plan for addressing
the problem of drug-related crime on the premises of the public housing
project(s) administered by the authority. (b) The division shall evaluate and select
programs for funding under this Part based upon a scoring system which will
include but not be limited to the following criteria: (1)
the extent of the drug-related crime
problem in the building(s) and grounds of the public housing project; (2)
the quality of the plan of the authority
to address drug-related crime in the public housing project(s); (3)
the capability of the authority to carry
out the plan; (4)
the anticipated
cost-effectiveness of the plan; (5)
the absence of funding available from other sources sufficient to carry out
such plan; and
(6)
the extent to
which the local government and local community support the anti-drug activities
of the housing authority. (c) The division shall notify those
authorities which have been awarded grants pursuant to this Part. All such
awards are to be contingent upon the execution of a contract between the
division and the housing authority upon such terms and conditions as the
division may prescribe. Notes
